lead_paragraph: The Buffalo Bills will receive $78 million — more than double their calculated operating income for 2006 — to play eight games in Toronto over the next five years. The payment to the Bills was disclosed Tuesday by Rogers Communications, which was part of a consortium that negotiated the deal for the games. The Bills’ first game is Aug. 14 against the Steelers at the Rogers Centre.
